timeline.message:
feat: add fromUntilTo in Interval

Signed-off-by: sendilkumarn <sendilkumarn@live.com>

timeline.author: nikhilnanivadekar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -176,6 +176,26 @@ public static Interval fromTo(int from, int to)
         return Interval.fromToBy(from, to, -1);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Returns an Interval starting from the value from until the specified value to (exclusive) with a step value of 1
+     */
+    public static Interval fromUntilTo(int from, int to)

replies.bodyText: I thought you were okay with some other signature for the API. Let me use fromToExclusive
replies.author: sendilkumarn

replies.bodyText: I am fine with the naming. Naming is hard, so I’ll let others also opine on naming
replies.author: nikhilnanivadekar

replies.bodyText: I like fromToExclusive better.  @motlin what's your opinion here?
replies.author: donraab

replies.bodyText: Took the until inspiration from the Kotlin. Changed the API to fromToExclusive to align with other APIs. :)
replies.author: sendilkumarn

timeline.bodyText: This will not work for negatives. For negatives it needs to be to+1
timeline.author: nikhilnanivadekar

replies.author: sendilkumarn

replies.bodyText: Hi @sendilkumarn , I think @nikhilnanivadekar comment above is why Interval.fromToExclusive(0, -9) is returning a size of 11.
replies.author: donraab
sendilkumarn

replies.bodyText:
What about the following?
Interval.fromToExclusive(10, 0)
Interval.fromToExclusive(100, 50)
replies.author: donraab

timeline.bodyText:
Please add tests for:

negative numbers
positive to negative numbers
negative to positive numbers
Integer.MIN to Integer.MAX
Integer.MAX to Integer.MIN
Tests to show parity with IntStream().range()
timeline.author: nikhilnanivadekar

timeline.bodyText: This looks incorrect. Interval.fromTo(0, -10) has a size of 11 right above. I would expect Interval.fromToExclusive(0, -9) to return a size of 9.
timeline.author: donraab
